text: Now when the wall had been built and I had erected the doors and appointed the gatekeepers, singers, and the Levites,
I gave command over Jerusalem to my brother Hanani and Hananiah the commander of the citadel. For he was a faithful man and feared God more than many.

I said to them, “Do not open the gates of Jerusalem until the sun is hot. While they are standing guard let them shut and fasten the doors. And appoint guards from the inhabitants of Jerusalem, one at his post and another opposite his house.”
The city \add was\add* widespread and large, but the people in it were few and no houses were rebuilt.
Lists of the Exiles Who Returned

Then my God put into my heart to assemble the nobles, the prefects, and the people to be enrolled. I found the book of the genealogy of those who first came back, and I found \add this\add* written upon it:

These are the people of the province who came up from captivity of the exiles whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried into exile. They returned to Jerusalem and to Judah, each one to his city.
These came with Zerubbabel, Joshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah.
The number of the men of the people of Israel:
the descendants\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Parosh, two thousand one hundred and seventy-two.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:9 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Shephatiah, three hundred and seventy-two.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:10 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Arah, six hundred and fifty-two.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Pahath-Moab, of the descendants\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred and eighteen.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Elam, one thousand two hundred and fifty-four.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:13 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Zattu, eight hundred and forty-five.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Binnui, six hundred and forty-eight.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:16 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Bebai, six hundred and twenty-eight.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:17 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Azgad, two thousand three hundred and twenty-two.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:18 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Adonikam, six hundred and sixty-seven.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:19 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Bigvai, two thousand and sixty-seven.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:20 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Adin, six hundred and fifty-five.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:21 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Ater, \add namely\add* of Hezekiah, ninety-eight.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:22 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hashum, three hundred and twenty-eight.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:23 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Bezai, three hundred and twenty-four.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:24 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hariph, one hundred and twelve.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:25 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Gibeon, ninety-five.
The men of Bethlehem and Netophah, one hundred and eighty-eight.
The men of Anathoth, one hundred and twenty-eight.
The men of Beth-azmaveth, forty-two.
The men of Kiriath-Jearim, Kephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty-three.
The men of Ramah and Geba, six hundred and twenty-one.
The men of Micmash, one hundred and twenty-two.
The men of Bethel and Ai, one hundred and twenty-three.
The men of the other Nebo, fifty-two.
The people\f + \fr 7:34 \ft Or “sons” \f* of the other Elam, one thousand two hundred and fifty-four.
The people\f + \fr 7:35 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Harim, three hundred and twenty.
The people\f + \fr 7:36 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Jericho, three hundred and forty-five.
The people\f + \fr 7:37 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred and twenty-one.
The people\f + \fr 7:38 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Senaah, three thousand nine hundred and thirty.
The priests: The descendants\f + \fr 7:39 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred and seventy-three.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:40 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Immer, one thousand and fifty-two.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:41 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred and forty-seven.
The descendants\f + \fr 7:42 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Harim, one thousand and seventeen.
The Levites: the descendants\f + \fr 7:43 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Jeshua, \add namely\add* of Kadmiel of the descendants\f + \fr 7:43 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hodaviah, seventy-four.
The singers: the descendants\f + \fr 7:44 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Asaph, one hundred and forty-eight.

The gatekeepers: the descendants\f + \fr 7:45 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Shallum, the descendants\f + \fr 7:45 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Ater, the descendants\f + \fr 7:45 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Talmon, the descendants\f + \fr 7:45 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Akkub, the descendants\f + \fr 7:45 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hatita, the descendants\f + \fr 7:45 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Shobai, one hundred and thirty-eight.
The temple servants: the descendants\f + \fr 7:46 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Ziha, the descendants\f + \fr 7:46 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hasupha, the descendants\f + \fr 7:46 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Tabbaoth,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:47 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Keros, the descendants\f + \fr 7:47 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Siaha, the descendants\f + \fr 7:47 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Padon,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:48 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Lebanah, the descendants\f + \fr 7:48 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hagaba, the descendants\f + \fr 7:48 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Shalmai,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:49 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hanan, the descendants\f + \fr 7:49 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Giddel, the descendants\f + \fr 7:49 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Gahar,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:50 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Reaiah, the descendants\f + \fr 7:50 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Rezin, the descendants\f + \fr 7:50 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Nekoda,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:51 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Gazzam, the descendants\f + \fr 7:51 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Uzza, the descendants\f + \fr 7:51 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Paseah,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:52 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Besai, the descendants\f + \fr 7:52 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Meunim, the descendants\f + \fr 7:52 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Nephushesim,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:53 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Bakbuk, the descendants\f + \fr 7:53 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hakupha, the descendants\f + \fr 7:53 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Harhur,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:54 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Bazlith, the descendants\f + \fr 7:54 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Mehida, the descendants\f + \fr 7:54 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Harsha,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:55 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Barkos, the descendants\f + \fr 7:55 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Sisera, the descendants\f + \fr 7:55 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Temah,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:56 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Neziah, the descendants\f + \fr 7:56 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hatipha.

The descendants\f + \fr 7:57 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Solomon’s servants: the descendants\f + \fr 7:57 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Sotai, the descendants\f + \fr 7:57 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Sophereth, the descendants\f + \fr 7:57 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Perida,
the descendants\f + \fr 7:58 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Jaala, the descendants\f + \fr 7:58 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Darkon, the descendants\f + \fr 7:58 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Giddel,

the descendants\f + \fr 7:59 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Shephatiah, the descendants\f + \fr 7:59 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hattil, the descendants\f + \fr 7:59 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Pochereth-Hazzebaim, the descendants\f + \fr 7:59 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Amon.
All the temple servants and the descendants\f + \fr 7:60 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Solomon’s servants were three hundred and ninety-two.
These were the ones who came up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer, but they were not able to prove their ancestral houses or their descent, whether they were from Israel:

the descendants\f + \fr 7:62 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Delaiah, the descendants\f + \fr 7:62 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Tobiah, the descendants\f + \fr 7:62 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Nekoda, six hundred and forty-two.

And from the priests: the descendants\f + \fr 7:63 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hobaiah, the descendants\f + \fr 7:63 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Hakkoz, the descendants\f + \fr 7:63 \ft Or “sons” \f* of Barzillai (who had taken as a wife from the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite and was called by their name).
These sought their record among those enrolled in the genealogy, but it was not found there, so they were excluded as unclean from the priesthood.
So the governor said to them that they could not eat the most holy food until a priest could come with Urim and Thummim.
All of the assembly together was forty-two thousand three hundred and sixty,

besides their servants and female slaves—these were seven thousand three hundred and thirty-seven. And the male and female singers were two hundred and forty-five,\f + \fr 7:67 \ft After this verse, some versions add verse \xt 68 \ft : “Their horses were seven hundred and thirty-six; their mules two hundred and forty-five”; compare \xt Ezra 2:66 \ft \f*

\f + \fr 7:69 \ft \xt Nehemiah 7:69–73 \ft in the English Bible is 7:68–72 in the Hebrew Bible \f* \add there were\add* four hundred and thirty-five camels and six thousand seven hundred and twenty male donkeys.

Now some from the heads of the ⸤families⸥\f + \fr 7:70 \ft Literally “fathers” \f* gave to the work. The governor gave to the storehouse one thousand darics of gold, fifty basins, and five hundred and thirty priestly tunics.
Now some of the heads of the ⸤families⸥\f + \fr 7:71 \ft Literally “fathers” \f* gave to the storehouse of the work twenty thousand gold darics and two thousand two hundred silver minas.
And what the rest of the people gave was twenty thousand darics of gold, and two thousand silver minas, and sixty-seven priestly tunics.

So the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, some of the people, the temple servants, and all Israel settled in their cities. When the seventh month came, the ⸤Israelites⸥\f + \fr 7:73 \ft Literally “sons/children of Israel” \f* \add were\add* in their cities.
